document.discussion_title: Early voting for West Virginia primary starts Wednesday
document.topic_text: Early voting for West Virginia primary starts Wednesday Posted: Party time: Voters switch political sides in droves CHARLESTON, WV (AP) - West Virginia voters can begin heading to the polls this week to cast votes ahead of the May 10 primary election. Early voting begins Wednesday and runs through May 7. Polls will be open on Saturdays. According to the Secretary of State's website, there are 1.22 million registered voters in the state, with 47 percent registered as Democrats, about 30 percent registered as Republicans and 20 percent with no party affiliation. Copyright 2016 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. Updated: Monday, April 25 2016 10:25 AM EDT 2016-04-25 14:25:30 GMT West Virginia voters can begin heading to the polls this week to cast votes ahead of the May 10 primary election. West Virginia voters can begin heading to the polls this week to cast votes ahead of the May 10 primary election. Updated: Sunday, April 24 2016 5:28 AM EDT 2016-04-24 09:28:08 GMT A Lincoln County court case is pointing out how complicated relationships can be in a community where everyone knows everyone else — as well as where people on both sides of an issue have to learn to get along. A Lincoln County court case is pointing out how complicated relationships can be in a community where everyone knows everyone else — as well as where people on both sides of an issue have to learn to get along. Updated: Saturday, April 23 2016 3:04 PM EDT 2016-04-23 19:04:06 GMT A team of research scientists from Protea Biosciences and the West Virginia University Cancer Institute used Protea’s proprietary bio-analytical technology to identify molecular changes occurring within drug-resistant lung cancer cells. A team of research scientists from Protea Biosciences and the West Virginia University Cancer Institute used Protea’s proprietary bio-analytical technology to identify molecular changes occurring within drug-resistant lung cancer cells. Friday, April 22 2016 6:00 PM EDT 2016-04-22 22:00:16 GMT John Perdue State Treasurer John Perdue said his office is looking for the rightful owners or beneficiaries of about 1,500 life insurance policies found languishing in forgotten safety deposit boxes. State Treasurer John Perdue said his office is looking for the rightful owners or beneficiaries of about 1,500 life insurance policies found languishing in forgotten safety deposit boxes. Updated: Friday, April 22 2016 5:42 PM EDT 2016-04-22 21:42:14 GMT A group of Republican lawmakers in the West Virginia House of Delegates remains adamantly opposed to raising taxes to help plug a $270 million hole in the state budget. A group of Republican lawmakers in the West Virginia House of Delegates remains adamantly opposed to raising taxes to help plug a $270 million hole in the state budget. Updated: Friday, April 22 2016 4:00 PM EDT 2016-04-22 20:00:22 GMT The Huntington Fire Department is looking for a few good men — or women. The Huntington Fire Civil Service Commission has extended the department’s current application period through May 31. The Huntington Fire Department is looking for a few good men — or women. The Huntington Fire Civil Service Commission has extended the department’s current application period through May 31. Friday, April 22 2016 11:25 AM EDT 2016-04-22 15:25:25 GMT Gov. Earl Ray Tomblin West Virginia Gov. Earl Ray Tomblin said he was disappointed, but not surprised that the state's failing economy has led to a downgrading of West Virginia's bond ratings. West Virginia Gov. Earl Ray Tomblin said he was disappointed, but not surprised that the state's failing economy has led to a downgrading of West Virginia's bond ratings. Updated: Thursday, April 21 2016 4:00 PM EDT 2016-04-21 20:00:22 GMT The spotlight was on Huntington as the Huntington Regional Chamber of Commerce celebrated its 125th annual dinner April 14 at the Marshall University Memorial Student Center. But Huntington had to share the night’s spotlight with Windsor Heights, West Virginia. Windsor Heights is a village in Brooke County, part of the Wheeling, West Virginia Metropolitan Statistical Area. The spotlight was on Huntington as the Huntington Regional Chamber of Commerce celebrated its 125th annual dinner April 14 at the Marshall University Memorial Student Center. But Huntington had to share the night’s spotlight with Windsor Heights, West Virginia. Windsor Heights is a village in Brooke County, part of the Wheeling, West Virginia Metropolitan Statistical Area. Updated: Wednesday, April 20 2016 12:24 PM EDT 2016-04-20 16:24:55 GMT U.S. Senator Shelley Moore Capito, R-W.Va., is chairing a hearing a 9:45 a.m. Thursday, April 21 to talk about the Nuclear Energy Innovation and Modernization Act and whether or not to allow new advanced nuclear reactors. U.S. Senator Shelley Moore Capito, R-W.Va., is chairing a hearing a 9:45 a.m. Thursday, April 21 to talk about the Nuclear Energy Innovation and Modernization Act and whether or not to allow new advanced nuclear reactors. Updated: Tuesday, April 19 2016 3:22 PM EDT 2016-04-19 19:22:20 GMT U.S. Rep. Evan Jenkins, R-W.Va., is among seven members of Congress co-sponsoring a bill aimed at helping infants born addicted to heroin. U.S. Rep. Evan Jenkins, R-W.Va., is among seven members of Congress co-sponsoring a bill aimed at helping infants born addicted to heroin. Updated: Saturday, April 2 2016 12:00 PM EDT 2016-04-02 16:00:19 GMT In a side nook at The Exotic Jungle sits a couch facing three large animal cages. Usually the cages house three or four cats — make that three or four lucky cats whose fate is now in great hands. In a side nook at The Exotic Jungle sits a couch facing three large animal cages. Usually the cages house three or four cats — make that three or four lucky cats whose fate is now in great hands. Updated: Thursday, December 31 2015 10:04 AM EST 2015-12-31 15:04:59 GMT Built in the mid-1950s and closed to traffic in 1987, the Memorial Tunnel on the West Virginia Turnpike was once a marvel, including the nation's first closed-circuit television monitors for surveillance in a tunnel. Built in the mid-1950s and closed to traffic in 1987, the Memorial Tunnel on the West Virginia Turnpike was once a marvel, including the nation's first closed-circuit television monitors for surveillance in a tunnel. Tuesday, December 22 2015 9:38 AM EST 2015-12-22 14:38:39 GMT Mine Rescue Day Tuesday, December 22 2015 9:34 AM EST 2015-12-22 14:34:57 GMT 2015 Veterans Day Parade Charleston WV 2015 Veterans Day Parade Charleston WV Tuesday, December 22 2015 9:30 AM EST 2015-12-22 14:30:32 GMT Wheeling Christmas Lights 2016 Generation Next: 40 Under 40 Event For 11 years, The State Journal has dedicated the Generation Next: 40 Under 40 program to highlighting a group of young professionals who push forward every day with their own dreams and plans to make West Virginia a better place. For 11 years, The State Journal has dedicated the Generation Next: 40 Under 40 program to highlighting a group of young professionals who push forward every day with their own dreams and plans to make West Virginia a better place. Meet The Smith Brothers Does it ever cross your mind who is behind the scenes making sure your campus is running smoothly? Does it ever cross your mind who is behind the scenes making sure your campus is running smoothly? EQT SOE: Where are they now With tuition costs continuing to rise, any prospective college student would benefit from a college scholarship in a financial sense. But Kelsey Scott and Brady Smith, who both won EQT Students of Excellence scholarships in 2011, agree receiving a scholarship isn’t just about the money. Send us a story idea! The State Journal welcomes your news tips and story ideas. For breaking news, please call our newsroom at 304-720-6550 . To email us your news tips and story ideas, please enter your email address below to continue: Email Address * We're sorry, but only one entry is allowed per person.Thank you for your continued interest. Thank you for submitting your news tip or story idea! Most Popular Stories Most Popular Stories More>> Updated: Sunday, April 24 2016 5:00 AM EDT 2016-04-24 09:00:12 GMT Widespread unemployment and drug addiction have dealt crushing blows to families and communities across West Virginia. The destruction has led to increased poverty and, in many cases, hopelessness. But as hard times hit West Virginia, there has been a remnant of people of faith and organizations rising to the challenge. Widespread unemployment and drug addiction have dealt crushing blows to families and communities across West Virginia. The destruction has led to increased poverty and, in many cases, hopelessness. But as hard times hit West Virginia, there has been a remnant of people of faith and organizations rising to the challenge. Updated: Sunday, April 24 2016 5:28 AM EDT 2016-04-24 09:28:08 GMT A Lincoln County court case is pointing out how complicated relationships can be in a community where everyone knows everyone else — as well as where people on both sides of an issue have to learn to get along. A Lincoln County court case is pointing out how complicated relationships can be in a community where everyone knows everyone else — as well as where people on both sides of an issue have to learn to get along. Friday, April 22 2016 6:00 PM EDT 2016-04-22 22:00:16 GMT John Perdue State Treasurer John Perdue said his office is looking for the rightful owners or beneficiaries of about 1,500 life insurance policies found languishing in forgotten safety deposit boxes. State Treasurer John Perdue said his office is looking for the rightful owners or beneficiaries of about 1,500 life insurance policies found languishing in forgotten safety deposit boxes. Updated: Sunday, April 24 2016 4:48 AM EDT 2016-04-24 08:48:08 GMT West Virginia is no stranger to the effects the boom-and-bust cycles of coal and natural gas can have on an economy. The Mountain State, which has largely been reliant on coal and natural gas production for decades, is struggling to stay afloat. Low fuel prices and weak global markets have caused extraction companies to slash capital spending and, in some cases, close their operations entirely. West Virginia is no stranger to the effects the boom-and-bust cycles of coal and natural gas can have on an economy. The Mountain State, which has largely been reliant on coal and natural gas production for decades, is struggling to stay afloat. Low fuel prices and weak global markets have caused extraction companies to slash capital spending and, in some cases, close their operations entirely.

Updated: Sunday, April 24 2016 4:48 AM EDT 2016-04-24 08:48:08 GMT West Virginia is no stranger to the effects the boom-and-bust cycles of coal and natural gas can have on an economy. The Mountain State, which has largely been reliant on coal and natural gas production for decades, is struggling to stay afloat. Low fuel prices and weak global markets have caused extraction companies to slash capital spending and, in some cases, close their operations entirely. West Virginia is no stranger to the effects the boom-and-bust cycles of coal and natural gas can have on an economy. The Mountain State, which has largely been reliant on coal and natural gas production for decades, is struggling to stay afloat. Low fuel prices and weak global markets have caused extraction companies to slash capital spending and, in some cases, close their operations entirely.
